1.text: A wise son hears his father’s instruction: but a scorner hears not rebuke.

2.text: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.

3.text: He that keeps his mouth keeps his life: but he that opens wide his lips shall have destruction.

4.text: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

5.text: A righteous man hates lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and comes to shame.

6.text: Righteousness keeps him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthrows the sinner.

7.text: There is that makes himself rich, yet has nothing: there is that makes himself poor, yet has great riches.

8.text: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor hears not rebuke.

9.text: The light of the righteous rejoices: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

10.text: Only by pride comes contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

11.text: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathers by labor shall increase.

12.text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick: but when the desire comes, it is a tree of life.

13.text: Whoever despises the word shall be destroyed: but he that fears the commandment shall be rewarded.

14.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

15.text: Good understanding gives favor: but the way of transgressors is hard.

16.text: Every prudent man deals with knowledge: but a fool lays open his folly.

17.text: A wicked messenger falls into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

18.text: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuses instruction: but he that regards reproof shall be honored.

19.text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.

20.text: He that walks with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

21.text: Evil pursues sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repaid.

22.text: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

23.text: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.

24.text: He that spares his rod hates his son: but he that loves him chastens him betimes.

25.text: The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
